text: A novel <extra_id_0> SP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site in the human <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter confers preferential transcriptional activity in keratinocytes .

To investigate the mechanisms of transcriptional activation of <extra_id_0> interleukin-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in non-monocytic cells , we constructed a series of reporter plasmids with the bacterial chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene linked to various parts of the human <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and performed transient transfection experiments .
We identified a promoter segment that activates transcription most efficiently in keratinocytes .
Electrophoretic mobility shift assays ( EMSA ) with a 43-mer oligonucleotide derived from the functionally identified cis - acting element revealed specific complexes .

By competition analysis with transcription factor consensus sequence oligonucleotides and by immunosupershift , transcription factor <extra_id_0> SP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or a closely related protein was shown to bind to this regulatory element .
The closest match to the known <extra_id_0> SP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> consensus sequence within the respective region is a TCCCCTCCCCT motif .

Mutation of this motif almost completely , and specifically , abolished the binding of two low - mobility complexes and led to a 95 % decrease of constitutive transcriptional activation of a reporter construct <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( -170 / +108 ) .

Likewise , activation of this reporter construct by <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> depended on the <extra_id_0> SP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site .

These observations suggest that a so-far-unrecognized <extra_id_0> SP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site in the human <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter may participate in the transcriptional regulation of this gene in keratinocytes .
